sen.j: 桶（おけ）とは、容器の一種である。
sen.e: Oke is a kind of container.
Oke is a kind of container.
Oke is a kind of container.

sen.j: 木製の桶とプラスチック製の桶が最も一般的である。
sen.e: The wooden oke and plastic oke are the most common.
The wooden oke and plastic oke are the most common.
The wooden oke and plastic oke are the most common.

tit.j: 樽と桶の区別について
tit.e: On the distinction between taru (barrel) and oke
On the distinction between taru (barrel) and oke
On the distinction between taru (barrel) and oke

sen.j: 日本の樽と桶は良く似た形であるが、樽は胴体の材料として板目材の板を使用する。
sen.e: Japanese taru and oke have very similar forms, but as a material the board of plain-sawn timber is used for the trunk of taru.
Japanese taru and oke have very similar forms, but as a material the board of plain-sawn timber is used for the trunk of taru.
Japanese taru and oke have very similar forms, but as a material the board of plain-sawn timber is used for the trunk of taru.

sen.j: いっぽう、桶の場合、風呂桶など液体のものを入れるための容器であることから、液体を逃がさないように柾目材を使用する。
sen.e: On the other hand, in the case of oke which is the container for liquid such as furo oke (bath tub) and so on, the quarter-sawn timber is used for the purpose of preventing the leak.
On the other hand, in the case of oke which is the container for liquid such as furo oke (bath tub) and so on, the quarter-sawn timber is used for the purpose of preventing the leak.
On the other hand, in the case of oke which is the container for liquid such as furo oke (bath tub) and so on, the quarter-sawn timber is used for the purpose of preventing the leak.

sen.j: ということであるが、日常生活では混同も多い。
sen.e: However, they are often used confusingly in daily life.
However, they are often used confusingly in daily life.
However, they are often used confusingly in daily life.

sen.j: フタ付きの物を「樽」、フタ無しの物を「桶」と呼ぶと言う説もある。
sen.e: Some say that the one with a lid is called "taru" and the one without a lid "oke."
Some say that the one with a lid is called 'taru' and the one without a lid 'oke.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: Some say that the one with a lid is called 'taru' and the one without a lid 'oke.'

sen.j: 例外も多いが、酒樽などは保存のためフタが閉じられた状態が常であり、風呂桶はフタが開けられた状態で使用することが普通である。
sen.e: There are many exceptions, but the lid of sakadaru (wine cask or barrel) is constantly closed for preservation and in the case of furo oke the lid is usually opened when taking a bath.
There are many exceptions, but the lid of sakadaru (wine cask or barrel) is constantly closed for preservation and in the case of furo oke the lid is usually opened when taking a bath.
There are many exceptions, but the lid of sakadaru (wine cask or barrel) is constantly closed for preservation and in the case of furo oke the lid is usually opened when taking a bath.

sen.j: 日本ではビン、陶磁器、漆器などに代わる容器として木製の桶が発明され、平安時代には一般に広まった。
sen.e: In Japan, oke made from wood was invented as a container instead of bottle, ceramic ware, lacquer ware and so on and popularized during the Heian period.
In Japan, oke made from wood was invented as a container instead of bottle, ceramic ware, lacquer ware and so on and popularized during the Heian period.
In Japan, oke made from wood was invented as a container instead of bottle, ceramic ware, lacquer ware and so on and popularized during the Heian period.

sen.j: これは、「曲物」（まげもの）とも呼ばれ、薄い板を円状に曲げ接着されたものであった。
sen.e: It is also called "magemono" (wooden bucket), in which thin boards are circularly bended and bonded.
It was also called 'magemono' (wooden bucket), in which thin boards were circularly bended and bonded.
sen.cmt: is→was、are→wereとし、シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: It was also called 'magemono' (wooden bucket), in which thin boards were circularly bended and bonded.

sen.j: 当初は麻糸をしまうための笥として用いられたとも言われ、「麻笥」・「麻の笥」と書く古い表記も存在する。
sen.e: At first, it is said to have been used as a tansu (chest of drawers) for storing hemp yarn and the ancient spelling "麻笥" and "麻の笥" (oke, bucket) exist.
At first, it is said to have been used as a tansu (笥; chest of drawers) for storing hemp (麻) yarn and the ancient spelling '麻笥' and '麻の笥' (oke, bucket) exist.
sen.cmt: 漢字が話題となっているため、理解しやすいよう"tansu (笥; chest of drawers)""hemp (麻)"としました。シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: At first, it is said to have been used as a tansu (笥; chest of drawers) for storing hemp (麻) yarn and the ancient spelling '麻笥' and '麻の笥' (oke, bucket) exist.

sen.j: 中国から輸入された桶に影響を受け誕生したものが「結桶」（ゆいおけ）と呼ばれる、現在の木製の桶である。
sen.e: The oke produced by the influence of the one imported from China is called yuioke (wooden bucket with a bottom), which is a present-day wooden oke.
The oke produced by the influence of the one imported from China is called yuioke (wooden bucket with a bottom), which is a present-day wooden oke.
The oke produced by the influence of the one imported from China is called yuioke (wooden bucket with a bottom), which is a present-day wooden oke.

sen.j: 細長い板を円状に並べ、竹などをらせん状に束ねた「たが」で結う結物構造となっており、接着剤等は使用しない。
sen.e: It has the structure where elongated boards are circularly lined up and tied with "taga" (hoop) which consists of spirally bundled bamboo, and does not use the adhesive.
It has the structure where elongated boards are circularly lined up and tied with 'taga' (hoop) which consists of spirally bundled bamboo, and does not use the adhesive.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: It has the structure where elongated boards are circularly lined up and tied with 'taga' (hoop) which consists of spirally bundled bamboo, and does not use the adhesive.

sen.j: 江戸時代には各家庭に必ずあるものになった。
sen.e: Each home in the Edo period always had it.
Each home in the Edo period always had it.
Each home in the Edo period always had it.

sen.j: この桶は江戸時代の食料などの保存・運搬に多大な影響を与えた。
sen.e: The oke greatly influenced the preservation and transportation of food products and so on during the Edo period.
The oke greatly influenced the preservation and transportation of food products and so on during the Edo period.
The oke greatly influenced the preservation and transportation of food products and so on during the Edo period.

sen.j: 現代日本では運搬や保存の用途で桶が用いられる機会は減り、日常的に用いられるのは風呂桶（バスタブ）や湯桶（ゆおけ。用途によっては洗面器とも）程度である。
sen.e: In modern Japan, the case to use oke for the purpose of transportation or preservation has decreased and instead furo oke (bath tub) or yuoke (or yuto, lacquered pot used for pouring hot water or sake) are used in a daily life. Yuoke is also called senmenki (wash basin) depending on the purposes.

In modern Japan, the case to use oke for the purpose of transportation or preservation has decreased and instead furo oke (bath tub) or yuoke (bucket for hot water; also called senmenki (wash basin) depending on the purposes) are used in a daily life.
sen.cmt: yuokeの補足修正 (ここでは「湯桶」→「ゆとう」とよむ場合の説明は不要と思われます)、仕様書に基づき次行の文をこちらに集約しました。
sen.e: In modern Japan, the case to use oke for the purpose of transportation or preservation has decreased and instead furo oke (bath tub) or yuoke (bucket for hot water; also called senmenki (wash basin) depending on the purposes) are used in a daily life.

sen.j: 広告媒体を兼ねて銭湯に置かれるケロリン桶が有名である。
sen.e: Kerorin oke (plastic bucket with advertisement of medicine, Kerorin inner aspect of the bottom) is famous and is put in a public bath also as an advertising medium.
Kerorin oke (plastic bucket with advertisement of medicine, Kerorin inner aspect of the bottom) is famous and is put in a public bath also as an advertising medium.
Kerorin oke (plastic bucket with advertisement of medicine, Kerorin inner aspect of the bottom) is famous and is put in a public bath also as an advertising medium.

sen.j: また、楽器としてもパーカションの一種として使われ、檜製の湯桶を裏底を表にして棒等の支えを裏に取り付けて、パーカッションセットに組み込んでいる。
sen.e: Also as a musical instrument it is used as a kind of percussion instrument, where they equip the back bottom of yuoke made from hinoki (Japanese cypress) with the support which are sticks and so on and incorporate it in the percussion set.

Also as a musical instrument it is used as a kind of percussion instrument, where they equip the back bottom of yuoke made from hinoki (Japanese cypress) with the support which are sticks and so on and incorporate it in the percussion set.

Also, as a musical instrument, a yuoke made from hinoki (Japanese cypress) is used as a kind of percussion instrument that is incorporated in percussion sets; this is done by turning the yuoke upside down and attaching sticks or other suitable objects to its base to act as supports.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて訳文を修正

sen.j: 演奏方法は、裏底をドラムの様にドラムスティックで叩いて音を出す。
sen.e: The playing style is that they sound it by beating the back bottom with drumsticks like a drumming style.
The playing style is that they sound it by beating the back bottom with drumsticks like a drumming style.
The playing style is that they sound it by beating the back bottom with drumsticks like a drumming style.

sen.j: たま (バンド)の石川浩司が演奏していた事で知られている。
sen.e: It is known that Koji ISHIKAWA in Tama (band) drummed it.
It is known that Koji ISHIKAWA in Tama (band) drummed it.
It is known that Koji ISHIKAWA in Tama (band) drummed it.

sen.j: たがが弛む
sen.e: Taga goes slack (the power or ability are weakened, or the discipline is loosened).
Taga goes slack (the power or ability are weakened, or the discipline is loosened).
Taga goes slack (the power or ability are weakened, or the discipline is loosened).

sen.j: 風が吹けば桶屋が儲かる
sen.e: If the wind blows the bucket makers prosper (any event can bring about an effect in an unexpected way).
If the wind blows the bucket makers prosper (any event can bring about an effect in an unexpected way).
If the wind blows the bucket makers prosper (any event can bring about an effect in an unexpected way).
